DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Disease or Disorder  Magnetic Resonance Imaging Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a patient's diagnosis as a result of the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site utilizing imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues or the fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic Disease or Disorder  Magnetic Resonance Imaging Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site utilizing imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues or the fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :(seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
